snippet.textDisplay: This game's OST now has a permanent spot in my workout/cardio playlist. Discovering this game's music reminds me years ago when I discovered another indie game's music, Shatter, which also had great electronic sounds.
snippet.textOriginal: This game's OST now has a permanent spot in my workout/cardio playlist. Discovering this game's music reminds me years ago when I discovered another indie game's music, Shatter, which also had great electronic sounds.

snippet.textDisplay: @Lurking Airman I wish I had enough free time to game all the time! I'd say I still do a pretty good job of keeping up, but I'd be lying if I said I don't have a huge and growing backlog. As for the music, I've developed over the years a way to quickly scan through various OSTs and identify personal standout tracks very fast. It helps that it's a passion for me and that I listen to VGM a lot while I'm working, helps me concentrate!
snippet.textOriginal: @Lurking Airman I wish I had enough free time to game all the time! I'd say I still do a pretty good job of keeping up, but I'd be lying if I said I don't have a huge and growing backlog. As for the music, I've developed over the years a way to quickly scan through various OSTs and identify personal standout tracks very fast. It helps that it's a passion for me and that I listen to VGM a lot while I'm working, helps me concentrate!

snippet.textDisplay: Supra, I fondly remember being introduced to Shatter's music by you many years ago. I still listen to it now and then. Thanks for all this :)
snippet.textOriginal: Supra, I fondly remember being introduced to Shatter's music by you many years ago. I still listen to it now and then. Thanks for all this :)

snippet.textDisplay: Dude this game's music and atmosphere is sick!! Tell us about yourself man. How do you know so much good game music? Do you game everything all the time?

snippet.textDisplay: A funky yet relaxing beat that'll take you on a galactic trip!
snippet.textOriginal: A funky yet relaxing beat that'll take you on a galactic trip!

snippet.textDisplay: This is reminding me a lot of Ghost Trick Fate Updated, but more HD. Speaking of which, I would love to see more Ghost Trick on this channel :)

Anyway, thank you SupraDarky! ^^

snippet.textDisplay: I own a VR arcade and have Sprint Vector offered here but it just doesn't get the love it deserves. The game is crazy good and it's a shame it didn't get to become more popular like Raw Data did. I just wish it was a little easier but my customers can struggle with the mechanics, especially the jumping part and that's required for basically every level.
snippet.textOriginal: I own a VR arcade and have Sprint Vector offered here but it just doesn't get the love it deserves. The game is crazy good and it's a shame it didn't get to become more popular like Raw Data did. I just wish it was a little easier but my customers can struggle with the mechanics, especially the jumping part and that's required for basically every level.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Oh yeah, Beat Saber is always in the top 3. SUPERHOT is another one for sure, Google Earth is usually high on the list, Job Simulator is crazy popular for the younger crowd, and now recently Pistol Whip is out and will likely get in the top titles.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Oh yeah, Beat Saber is always in the top 3. SUPERHOT is another one for sure, Google Earth is usually high on the list, Job Simulator is crazy popular for the younger crowd, and now recently Pistol Whip is out and will likely get in the top titles.

snippet.textDisplay: That's super interesting, I wasn't even aware that VR arcades existed! I'm not surprised to hear that about SV, for some reason the game really stayed under the radar. What is the most popular game there, is it Raw Data? My first guess would be Beat Saber.
